the main façade , built from red brick and portland stone , stretches 720 feet -lrb- 220 m -rrb- along cromwell gardens and was designed by aston webb after winning a competition in 1891 to extend the museum .	how long does the main façade stretch along cromwell gardens ?	stretches 720 feet -lrb- 220 m -rrb- along cromwell gardens and was designed by aston webb after winning a competition in 1891 to extend the museum
likewise the tower above the main entrance has an open work crown surmounted by a statue of fame , a feature of late gothic architecture and a feature common in scotland , but the detail is classical .	what late gothic architectural sculptural feature is found on the tower above the main entrance ?	likewise the tower above the main entrance has an open work crown surmounted by a statue of fame
the main windows to the galleries are also mullioned and transomed , again a gothic feature , the top row of windows are interspersed with statues of many of the british artists whose work is displayed in the museum .	statues of british artists adorn which part of the tower above the main entrance ?	the top row of windows are interspersed with statues of many of the british artists whose work is displayed in the museum
prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances , queen victoria above the frame around the arches and entrance , sculpted by alfred drury .	who sculpted the representations of prince albert and queen victoria found in the main entrance ?	prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances
these façades surround four levels of galleries .	how many levels of galleries do the façades surround ?	these façades surround four levels of galleries
prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances , queen victoria above the frame around the arches and entrance , sculpted by alfred drury .	who designed the entrance hall and rotunda ?	prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances
the interior makes much use of marble in the entrance hall and flanking staircases , although the galleries as originally designed were white with restrained classical detail and mouldings , very much in contrast to the elaborate decoration of the victorian galleries , although much of this decoration was removed in the early 20th century .	what building material does the entrance hall and flanking staircases use predominantly ?	although the galleries as originally designed were white with restrained classical detail and mouldings
prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances , queen victoria above the frame around the arches and entrance , sculpted by alfred drury .	which british monarch appears above the frame around the arches and entrance ?	prince albert appears within the main arch above the twin entrances
the 1950s and early 1960s saw little in the way of building work ; the first major work was the creation of new storage space for books in the art library in 1966 and 1967 .	which part of the museum received the first major post-war work ?	the first major work was the creation of new storage space for books in the art library in 1966 and 1967
in 1974 the museum had acquired what is now the henry cole wing from the royal college of science .	what did the museum acquire from the royal college of science ?	in 1974 the museum had acquired what is now the henry cole wing from the royal college of science
to link this to the rest of the museum , a new entrance building was constructed on the site of the former boiler house , the intended site of the spiral , between 1978 and 1982 .	what was constructed between 1978 and 1982 to link the henry cole wing to the rest of the museum ?	a new entrance building was constructed on the site of the former boiler house
this building is of concrete and very functional , the only embellishment being the iron gates by christopher hay and douglas coyne of the royal college of art .	who designed the iron gates that decorate the new entrance building ?	the only embellishment being the iron gates by christopher hay and douglas coyne of the royal college of art
to link this to the rest of the museum , a new entrance building was constructed on the site of the former boiler house , the intended site of the spiral , between 1978 and 1982 .	what was intended for the site of the former boiler house ?	a new entrance building was constructed on the site of the former boiler house
a few galleries were redesigned in the 1990s including the indian , japanese , chinese , iron work , the main glass galleries and the main silverware gallery which was further enhanced in 2002 when some of the victorian decoration was recreated .	which gallery was redesigned in the 1990s and later improved in 2002 ?	the main glass galleries and the main silverware gallery which was further enhanced in 2002 when some of the victorian decoration was recreated
as part of the 2006 renovation the mosaic floors in the sculpture gallery were restored -- most of the victorian floors were covered in linoleum after the second world war .	what was restored in the sculpture gallery during its renovated in 2006 ?	as part of the 2006 renovation the mosaic floors in the sculpture gallery were restored -- most of the victorian floors were covered in linoleum after the second world war
after the success of the british galleries , opened in 2001 , it was decided to embark on a major redesign of all the galleries in the museum ; this is known as `` futureplan '' , and was created in consultation with the exhibition designers and masterplanners metaphor .	what was the title given to the major project to redesign all the galleries in the museum ?	and was created in consultation with the exhibition designers and masterplanners metaphor
to date several galleries have been redesigned , notably , in 2002 : the main silver gallery , contemporary ; in 2003 : photography , the main entrance , the painting galleries ; in 2004 : the tunnel to the subway leading to south kensington tube station , new signage throughout the museum , architecture , v&a and riba reading rooms and stores , metalware , members ' room , contemporary glass , the gilbert bayes sculpture gallery ; in 2005 : portrait miniatures , prints and drawings , displays in room 117 , the garden , sacred silver and stained glass ; in 2006 : central hall shop , islamic middle east , the new café , sculpture galleries .	a subway tunnel from the museum leads to which tube station ?	in 2004 : the tunnel to the subway leading to south kensington tube station
gareth hoskins was responsible for contemporary and architecture , softroom , islamic middle east and the members ' room , mcinnes usher mcknight architects -lrb- muma -rrb- were responsible for the new cafe and designed the new medieval and renaissance galleries which opened in 2009 .	who designed the new medieval and renaissance galleries which opened in 2009 ?	mcinnes usher mcknight architects -lrb- muma -rrb- were responsible for the new cafe and designed the new medieval and renaissance galleries which opened in 2009
the central garden was redesigned by kim wilkie and opened as the john madejski garden , on 5 july 2005 .	who redesigned the central garden ?	the central garden was redesigned by kim wilkie and opened as the john madejski garden
the central garden was redesigned by kim wilkie and opened as the john madejski garden , on 5 july 2005 .	the redesigned central garden opened in 2005 with what new moniker ?	the central garden was redesigned by kim wilkie and opened as the john madejski garden
the design is a subtle blend of the traditional and modern , the layout is formal ; there is an elliptical water feature lined in stone with steps around the edge which may be drained to use the area for receptions , gatherings or exhibition purposes .	what shape is the water feature in the john madejski garden ?	there is an elliptical water feature lined in stone with steps around the edge which may be drained to use the area for receptions

this is in front of the bronze doors leading to the refreshment rooms , a central path flanked by lawns leads to the sculpture gallery ; the north , east and west sides have herbaceous borders along the museum walls with paths in front which continues along the south façade ; in the two corners by the north façade there is planted an american sweetgum tree ; the southern , eastern and western edges of the lawns have glass planters which contain orange and lemon trees in summer , these are replaced by bay trees in winter .	which tree species is planted in the two corners by the north facade ?	east and west sides have herbaceous borders along the museum walls with paths in front which continues along the south façade
in 2004 , the v&a alongside royal institute of british architects opened the first permanent gallery in the uk covering the history of architecture with displays using models , photographs , elements from buildings and original drawings .	in which year did the v&a opened the first permanent architectural history gallery in the uk ?	the v&a alongside royal institute of british architects opened the first permanent gallery in the uk covering the history of architecture with displays using models

with over 600,000 drawings , over 750,000 papers and paraphernalia , and over 700,000 photographs from around the world , together they form the world 's most comprehensive architectural resource .	approximately how many architectural drawings does the v&a hold in its collection ?	together they form the world 's most comprehensive architectural resource
with the opening of the new gallery , the riba drawings and archives collection has been transferred to the museum , joining the already extensive collection held by the v&a .	what collection was transferred to the museum when the new architectural history gallery opened ?	the riba drawings and archives collection has been transferred to the museum
with over 600,000 drawings , over 750,000 papers and paraphernalia , and over 700,000 photographs from around the world , together they form the world 's most comprehensive architectural resource .	approximately how many architectural photographs does the v&a hold in its collection ?	together they form the world 's most comprehensive architectural resource
the riba 's holdings of over 330 drawings by andrea palladio are the largest in the world , other europeans well represented are jacques gentilhatre and antonio visentini .	the riba 's drawing collection of what italian architect is considered the largest in the world ?	the riba 's holdings of over 330 drawings by andrea palladio are the largest in the world

as well as period rooms , the collection includes parts of buildings , for example the two top stories of the facade of sir paul pindar 's house dated c1600 from bishopsgate with elaborately carved wood work and leaded windows , a rare survivor of the great fire of london , there is a brick portal from a london house of the english restoration period and a fireplace from the gallery of northumberland house .	which part of london was sir paul pindar 's house , whose façade now resides in the v&a collection , located ?	for example the two top stories of the facade of sir paul pindar 's house dated c1600 from bishopsgate with elaborately carved wood work and leaded windows

the main architecture gallery has a series of pillars from various buildings and different periods , for example a column from the alhambra .	a column from which moorish palace and fortress complex in granada , spain , is included in the v&a collection ?	the main architecture gallery has a series of pillars from various buildings and different periods
the v&a holds over 19,000 items from the islamic world , ranging from the early islamic period -lrb- the 7th century -rrb- to the early 20th century .	approximately how many items from the islamic world are held in the v&a collection ?	ranging from the early islamic period -lrb- the 7th century -rrb- to the early 20th century

the collection of middle eastern and persian rugs and carpets is amongst the finest in the world , many were part of the salting bequest of 1909 .	in which year was the salting bequest ?	the collection of middle eastern and persian rugs and carpets is amongst the finest in the world

one of the finest objects displayed is suzuki chokichi 's bronze incense burner -lrb- koro -rrb- dated 1875 , standing at over 2.25 metres high and 1.25 metres in diameter it is also one of the largest examples made .	suzuki chokichi 's incense burner dated 1875 is made of what from material ?	one of the finest objects displayed is suzuki chokichi 's bronze incense burner -lrb- koro -rrb- dated 1875
tibetan art from the 14th to the 19th century is represented by notable 14th - and 15th-century religious images in wood and bronze , scroll paintings and ritual objects .	tibetan art from which period is represented in the v&a collection ?	tibetan art from the 14th to the 19th century is represented by notable 14th - and 15th-century religious images in wood and bronze
art from thailand , burma , cambodia , indonesia and sri lanka in gold , silver , bronze , stone , terracotta and ivory represents these rich and complex cultures , the displays span the 6th to 19th centuries .	which south asian island nation is represented in the v&a collection ?	terracotta and ivory represents these rich and complex cultures
refined hindu and buddhist sculptures reflect the influence of india ; items on show include betel-nut cutters , ivory combs and bronze palanquin hooks .	the influence of india can be seen in which religious art objects from thailand , burma and cambodia ?	refined hindu and buddhist sculptures reflect the influence of india
korean displays include green-glazed ceramics , silk embroideries from officials ' robes and gleaming boxes inlaid with mother-of-pearl made between 500 ad and 2000 .	some of the museum 's collection of korean boxes are inlaid with what objects ?	silk embroideries from officials ' robes and gleaming boxes inlaid with mother-of-pearl made between 500 ad and 2000
refined hindu and buddhist sculptures reflect the influence of india ; items on show include betel-nut cutters , ivory combs and bronze palanquin hooks .	some of the combs in the v&a collection of south east asian art is made of what material ?	refined hindu and buddhist sculptures reflect the influence of india
one of the great treasures in the library is the codex forster , some of leonardo da vinci 's note books .	the codex forster is a collection of notebooks by which famous italian renaissance polymath ?	one of the great treasures in the library is the codex forster
the codex consists of three parchment-bound manuscripts , forster i , forster ii , and forster iii , quite small in size , dated between 1490 and 1505 .	what are the three parchment-bound manuscripts of the codex forster called ?	the codex consists of three parchment-bound manuscripts

one of the most dramatic parts of the museum is the cast courts in the sculpture wing , comprising two large , skylighted rooms two storeys high housing hundreds of plaster casts of sculptures , friezes and tombs .	the cast courts display plaster casts of what objects ?	one of the most dramatic parts of the museum is the cast courts in the sculpture wing

because everyday clothing from previous eras has not generally survived , the collection is dominated by fashionable clothes made for special occasions .	why is the collection dominated by fashionable clothes made for special occasions ?	the collection is dominated by fashionable clothes made for special occasions

the collection includes the earliest known piece of english silver with a dated hallmark , a silver gilt beaker dated 1496 -- 97 .	to which year is the earliest known piece of english silver with a dated hallmark is dated ?	the collection includes the earliest known piece of english silver with a dated hallmark
one of the largest items is the hereford screen , weighing nearly 8 tonnes , 10.5 metres high and 11 metres wide , designed by sir george gilbert scott in 1862 for the chancel in hereford cathedral , from which it was removed in 1967 .	how many tons does the hereford screen weigh ?	designed by sir george gilbert scott in 1862 for the chancel in hereford cathedral

one of the rarest items in the collection is the 58 cm high gloucester candlestick , dated to c1110 , made from gilt bronze ; with highly elaborate and intricate intertwining branches containing small figures and inscriptions , it is a tour de force of bronze casting .	to which year is the gloucester candlestick dated ?	with highly elaborate and intricate intertwining branches containing small figures and inscriptions

an online petition of over 5,100 names on the parliamentary website led to chris smith asking parliament about the future of the collection .	approximately how many names were signed on an online petition on the parliamentary website in response to the closing of the musical instruments gallery ?	100 names on the parliamentary website led to chris smith asking parliament about the future of the collection
the answer , from bryan davies was that the museum intended to preserve and care for the collection and keep it available to the public , with items being redistributed to the british galleries , the medieval & renaissance galleries , and the planned new galleries for furniture and europe 1600 -- 1800 , and that the horniman museum and other institutions were possible candidates for loans of material to ensure that the instruments remained publicly viewable .	which member of parliament explained how the museum would preserve the collection and keep it available to the public ?	and that the horniman museum and other institutions were possible candidates for loans of material to ensure that the instruments remained publicly viewable
the answer , from bryan davies was that the museum intended to preserve and care for the collection and keep it available to the public , with items being redistributed to the british galleries , the medieval & renaissance galleries , and the planned new galleries for furniture and europe 1600 -- 1800 , and that the horniman museum and other institutions were possible candidates for loans of material to ensure that the instruments remained publicly viewable .	which museum would receive items on loans from the musical instruments gallery ?	and that the horniman museum and other institutions were possible candidates for loans of material to ensure that the instruments remained publicly viewable
the horniman went on to host a joint exhibition with the v&a of musical instruments , and has the loan of 35 instruments from the museum .	approximately how many musical instruments were loaned to the horniman museum ?	the horniman went on to host a joint exhibition with the v&a of musical instruments
the musical instruments gallery closed 25 february 2010 , a decision which was highly controversial .	in which year was the musical instruments gallery closed ?	the musical instruments gallery closed 25 february 2010
the collection includes about 1130 british and 650 european oil paintings , 6800 british watercolours , pastels and 2000 miniatures , for which the museum holds the national collection .	approximately how many british oil paintings does the museum have ?	the collection includes about 1130 british and 650 european oil paintings

also on loan to the museum , from her majesty the queen elizabeth ii , are the raphael cartoons : the seven surviving -lrb- there were ten -rrb- full scale designs for tapestries in the sistine chapel , of the lives of peter and paul from the gospels and the acts of the apostles .	who has loaned the raphael cartoons to the museum ?	are the raphael cartoons : the seven surviving -lrb- there were ten -rrb- full scale designs for tapestries in the sistine chapel
one of the largest objects in the collection is the spanish tempera on wood , 670 x 486 cm , retable of st george , c. 1400 , consisting of numerous scenes and painted by andrés marzal de sax in valencia .	who painted the retable of st. george that is in the v&a collection ?	consisting of numerous scenes and painted by andrés marzal de sax in valencia
in 1857 john sheepshanks donated 233 paintings , mainly by contemporary british artists , and a similar number of drawings to the museum with the intention of forming a ' a national gallery of british art ' , a role since taken on by tate britain ; artists represented are william blake , james barry , henry fuseli , sir edwin henry landseer , sir david wilkie , william mulready , william powell frith , millais and hippolyte delaroche .	in which year did john sheepshanks donated a large collection of paintings ?	and a similar number of drawings to the museum with the intention of forming a ' a national gallery of british art '

although some of constable 's works came to the museum with the sheepshanks bequest , the majority of the artist 's works were donated by his daughter isabel in 1888 , including the large number of sketches in oil , the most significant being the 1821 full size oil sketch for the hay wain .	an 1821 full size oil sketch of which famous british painting was donated by john sheepshank 's daughter in 1888 ?	although some of constable 's works came to the museum with the sheepshanks bequest

several french paintings entered the collection as part of the 260 paintings and miniatures -lrb- not all the works were french , for example carlo crivelli 's virgin and child -rrb- that formed part of the jones bequest of 1882 and as such are displayed in the galleries of continental art 1600 -- 1800 , including the portrait of françois , duc d'alençon by françois clouet , gaspard dughet and works by françois boucher including his portrait of madame de pompadour dated 1758 , jean françois de troy , jean-baptiste pater and their contemporaries .	in which galleries are the french paintings donated by jones displayed ?	for example carlo crivelli 's virgin and child -rrb- that formed part of the jones bequest of 1882 and as such are displayed in the galleries of continental art 1600 -- 1800

the museum also holds james lafayette 's society portraits , a collection of more than 600 photographs dating from the late 19th to early 20th centuries and portraying a wide range of society figures of the period , including bishops , generals , society ladies , indian maharajas , ethiopian rulers and other foreign leaders , actresses , people posing in their motor cars and a sequence of photographs recording the guests at the famous fancy-dress ball held at devonshire house in 1897 to celebrate queen victoria 's diamond jubilee .	whose society portraits from the late 19th to early 20th centuries does the v&a hold ?	people posing in their motor cars and a sequence of photographs recording the guests at the famous fancy-dress ball held at devonshire house in 1897 to celebrate queen victoria 's diamond jubilee
the sculpture collection at the v&a is the most comprehensive holding of post-classical european sculpture in the world .	the v&a has the world 's most comprehensive collection of sculptures from which period ?	the sculpture collection at the v&a is the most comprehensive holding of post-classical european sculpture in the world
there are approximately 22,000 objects in the collection that cover the period from about 400 ad to 1914 .	approximately how many objects are in the v&a sculpture collection ?	000 objects in the collection that cover the period from about 400 ad to 1914
there are approximately 22,000 objects in the collection that cover the period from about 400 ad to 1914 .	which time period does the sculpture collection cover ?	000 objects in the collection that cover the period from about 400 ad to 1914
all uses of sculpture are represented , from tomb and memorial , to portrait , allegorical , religious , mythical , statues for gardens including fountains , as well as architectural decorations .	which uses of sculpture are represented in the collection ?	statues for gardens including fountains
it includes canova 's the three graces , which the museum jointly owns with national galleries of scotland .	with which museum does the v&a co-owns canova 's the three graces ?	which the museum jointly owns with national galleries of scotland
italian sculptors whose work is held by the museum include : bartolomeo bon , bartolomeo bellano , luca della robbia , giovanni pisano , donatello , agostino di duccio , andrea riccio , antonio rossellino , andrea del verrocchio , antonio lombardo , pier jacopo alari bonacolsi , andrea della robbia , michelozzo di bartolomeo , michelangelo -lrb- represented by a freehand wax model and casts of his most famous sculptures -rrb- , jacopo sansovino , alessandro algardi , antonio calcagni , benvenuto cellini -lrb- medusa 's head dated c. 1547 -rrb- , agostino busti , bartolomeo ammannati , giacomo della porta , giambologna -lrb- samson slaying a philistine -lrb- giambologna -rrb- c. 1562 , his finest work outside italy -rrb- , bernini -lrb- neptune and triton c. 1622 -- 3 -rrb- , giovanni battista foggini , vincenzo foggini -lrb- samson and the philistines -rrb- , massimiliano soldani benzi , antonio corradini , andrea brustolon , giovanni battista piranesi , innocenzo spinazzi , canova , carlo marochetti and raffaelle monti .	which c1622-23 sculpture by bernini are included in the sculpture collection ?	michelangelo -lrb- represented by a freehand wax model and casts of his most famous sculptures -rrb-
the largest item from italy is the chancel chapel from santa chiara florence dated 1493 -- 1500 , designed by giuliano da sangallo it is 11.1 metres in height by 5.4 metres square , it includes a grand sculpted tabernacle by antonio rossellino and coloured terracotta decoration .	what is the largest item from italy that is part of the sculpture collection ?	it includes a grand sculpted tabernacle by antonio rossellino and coloured terracotta decoration

rodin is represented by more than 20 works in the museum collection , making it one of the largest collections of the sculptor 's work outside france ; these were given to the museum by the sculptor in 1914 , as acknowledgement of britain 's support of france in world war i , although the statue of st john the baptist had been purchased in 1902 by public subscription .	approximately how many works by rodin are part of the museum collection ?	although the statue of st john the baptist had been purchased in 1902 by public subscription

with the opening of the dorothy and michael hintze sculpture galleries in 2006 it was decided to extend the chronology of the works on display up to 1950 ; this has involved loans by other museums , including tate britain , so works by henry moore and jacob epstein along with other of their contemporaries are now on view .	who were the sculpture galleries that opened in 2006 named after ?	with the opening of the dorothy and michael hintze sculpture galleries in 2006 it was decided to extend the chronology of the works on display up to 1950

the collection of textiles consists of more than 53,000 examples , mainly western european though all populated continents are represented , dating from the 1st century ad to the present , this is the largest such collection in the world .	approximately how many items are in the v&a 's textiles collection ?	mainly western european though all populated continents are represented

these are classified by technique , countries of origin and date of production .	besides countries of origin and date of production , how are the textiles classified ?	countries of origin and date of production
the tapestry collection includes a fragment of the cloth of st gereon , the oldest known surviving european tapestry .	what is the oldest surviving european tapestry in the v&a collection ?	the tapestry collection includes a fragment of the cloth of st gereon

the v&a theatre & performance galleries , formerly the theatre museum , opened in march 2009 .	what is the former name of the v&a theatre & performance galleries ?	the v&a theatre & performance galleries
the v&a theatre & performance galleries , formerly the theatre museum , opened in march 2009 .	in which year did the v&a theatre & performance galleries open ?	the v&a theatre & performance galleries
they hold the uk 's biggest national collection of material about live performance in the uk since shakespeare 's day , covering drama , dance , musical theatre , circus , music hall , rock and pop , and most other forms of live entertainment .	what collection does the v&a theatre & performance galleries hold ?	they hold the uk 's biggest national collection of material about live performance in the uk since shakespeare 's day
they hold the uk 's biggest national collection of material about live performance in the uk since shakespeare 's day , covering drama , dance , musical theatre , circus , music hall , rock and pop , and most other forms of live entertainment .	the theatre collection starts from the time of which famous elizabethan playwright ?	they hold the uk 's biggest national collection of material about live performance in the uk since shakespeare 's day
the collections are stored by the v&a , and are available for research , exhibitions and other shows .	the material in the v&a theatre collection is available for which use ?	the collections are stored by the v&a
conservation is responsible for the long-term preservation of the collections , and covers all the collections held by the v&a and the v&a museum of childhood .	which area is responsible for the long-term preservation of the v&a collections ?	and covers all the collections held by the v&a and the v&a museum of childhood
activities include controlling the museum environment -lrb- for example , temperature and light -rrb- and preventing pests -lrb- primarily insects -rrb- from damaging artefacts .	what two environmental conditions are controlled in the museum ?	temperature and light -rrb- and preventing pests -lrb- primarily insects -rrb- from damaging artefacts
the other major category is `` interventive '' conservation , this includes : cleaning and reintegration to strengthen fragile objects , reveal original surface decoration , and restore shape .	what major category of conservation result in an object that is more attractive and more comprehensible to the viewer ?	this includes : cleaning and reintegration to strengthen fragile objects
conservation is responsible for the long-term preservation of the collections , and covers all the collections held by the v&a and the v&a museum of childhood .	besides the v&a 's , whose collections are under the responsibility of conservators at the v&a ?	and covers all the collections held by the v&a and the v&a museum of childhood
areas covered by conservator 's work include `` preventive '' conservation this includes : performing surveys , assessments and providing advice on the handling of items , correct packaging , mounting and handling procedures during movement and display to reduce risk of damaging objects .	what type of conservation include providing advice on the handling of items ?	areas covered by conservator 's work include `` preventive '' conservation this includes : performing surveys
the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company .	what company owns the american broadcasting company ?	the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group
the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company .	in what year did abc stylize it 's logo as abc ?	the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group
the network is headquartered on columbus avenue and west 66th street in manhattan , with additional major offices and production facilities in new york city , los angeles and burbank , california .	in what borough of new york city is abc headquartered ?	the network is headquartered on columbus avenue and west 66th street in manhattan
the network is headquartered on columbus avenue and west 66th street in manhattan , with additional major offices and production facilities in new york city , los angeles and burbank , california .	on what streets is the abc headquarters located	the network is headquartered on columbus avenue and west 66th street in manhattan
the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group , a subsidiary of disney media networks division of the walt disney company .	disney-abc television group is a subsidiary of what division of the walt disney company ?	the american broadcasting company -lrb- abc -rrb- -lrb- stylized in its logo as abc since 1957 -rrb- is an american commercial broadcast television network that is owned by the disney -- abc television group
abc originally launched on october 12 , 1943 as a radio network , separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network , which had been purchased by edward j. noble .	when did abc first start ?	separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network
abc originally launched on october 12 , 1943 as a radio network , separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network , which had been purchased by edward j. noble .	what kind of network was abc when it first began ?	separated from and serving as the successor to the nbc blue network
it extended its operations to television in 1948 , following in the footsteps of established broadcast networks cbs and nbc .	when did abc first get in to television broadcasts ?	following in the footsteps of established broadcast networks cbs and nbc
in the 1980s , after purchasing an 80 % interest in cable sports channel espn , the network 's parent merged with capital cities communications , owner of several print publications , and television and radio stations .	in the 1980s , what cable sports channel did abc purchase ?	the network 's parent merged with capital cities communications

the television network has eight owned-and-operated and over 232 affiliated television stations throughout the united states and its territories .	how many affiliated stations does abc currently have ?	the television network has eight owned-and-operated and over 232 affiliated television stations throughout the united states and its territories
abc news provides news and features content for select radio stations owned by citadel broadcasting , which purchased the abc radio properties in 2007 .	in 2007 , what company purchased abc radio properties ?	abc news provides news and features content for select radio stations owned by citadel broadcasting
the television network has eight owned-and-operated and over 232 affiliated television stations throughout the united states and its territories .	how many of the network 's stations are owned-and-operated ?	the television network has eight owned-and-operated and over 232 affiliated television stations throughout the united states and its territories
most canadians have access to at least one u.s.-based abc affiliate , either over-the-air -lrb- in areas located within proximity to the canada -- united states border -rrb- or through a cable , satellite or iptv provider , although most abc programs are subject to simultaneous substitution regulations imposed by the canadian radio-television and telecommunications commission that allow pay television providers to replace an american station 's signal with the feed of a canadian broadcaster to protect domestic programming rights and advertising revenue .	what entity in canada handles substitution regulations for television shows ?	although most abc programs are subject to simultaneous substitution regulations imposed by the canadian radio-television and telecommunications commission that allow pay television providers to replace an american station 's signal with the feed of a canadian broadcaster to protect domestic programming rights and advertising revenue

in 1934 , mutual filed a complaint with the federal communications commission -lrb- fcc -rrb- regarding its difficulties in establishing new stations , in a radio market that was already being saturated by nbc and cbs .	what company filed a complaint with the fcc in 1934 concerning problems establishing new stations ?	mutual filed a complaint with the federal communications commission -lrb- fcc -rrb- regarding its difficulties in establishing new stations
in 1938 , the fcc began a series of investigations into the practices of radio networks and published its report on the broadcasting of network radio programs in 1940 .	in what year did the fcc begin an investigation in to the operation of radio networks in america	the fcc began a series of investigations into the practices of radio networks and published its report on the broadcasting of network radio programs in 1940

at that time , the nbc red network was the principal radio network in the united states and , according to the fcc , rca was using nbc blue to eliminate any hint of competition .	what was the main radio network in the 1940s in america ?	the nbc red network was the principal radio network in the united states and
at that time , the nbc red network was the principal radio network in the united states and , according to the fcc , rca was using nbc blue to eliminate any hint of competition .	what radio network was rca using to eliminate competition in 1940 ?	the nbc red network was the principal radio network in the united states and
once mutual 's appeals against the fcc were rejected , rca decided to sell nbc blue in 1941 , and gave the mandate to do so to mark woods .	to whom did rca mandate the sale of nbc blue to in 1941 ?	once mutual 's appeals against the fcc were rejected
rca converted the nbc blue network into an independent subsidiary , formally divorcing the operations of nbc red and nbc blue on january 8 , 1942 , with the blue network being referred to on-air as either `` blue '' or `` blue network '' .	what network was converted into an independent subsidiary by rca in 1942 ?	with the blue network being referred to on-air as either `` blue '' or `` blue network ''

however , abc made a name for itself by utilizing the practice of counterprogramming , with which it often placed shows of its own against the offerings of nbc and cbs , adopting the use of the magnetophon tape recorder , brought to the u.s. from nazi germany after its conquest , to pre-record its programming .	what new technology allowed abc to pre-record its shows ?	with which it often placed shows of its own against the offerings of nbc and cbs
abc became an aggressive competitor to nbc and cbs when , continuing nbc blue 's traditions of public service , it aired symphony performances conducted by paul whiteman , performances from the metropolitan opera , and jazz concerts aired as part of its broadcast of the chamber music society of lower basin street announced by milton cross .	abc aired symphony performances by what conductor ?	and jazz concerts aired as part of its broadcast of the chamber music society of lower basin street announced by milton cross

with the help of the magnetophon , abc was able to provide its stars with greater freedom in terms of time , and also attract several big names , such as bing crosby at a time when nbc and cbs did not allow pre-taped shows .	who was a big star that abc was able to attract because of magnetophon technology ?	such as bing crosby at a time when nbc and cbs did not allow pre-taped shows

the arrival of satellite television ended the need for abc to hold interests in other countries ; many governments also wanted to increase their independence and strengthen legislation to limit foreign ownership of broadcasting properties .	what ended the need for abc to maintain interests in other countries ?	many governments also wanted to increase their independence and strengthen legislation to limit foreign ownership of broadcasting properties

before the freeze ended in 1952 , there were only 108 existing television stations in the united states ; a few major cities -lrb- such as boston -rrb- had only two television stations , many other cities -lrb- such as pittsburgh and st. louis -rrb- had only one , and still many others -lrb- such as denver and portland -rrb- did not yet have any television service .	in 1952 , how many television stations were there in the united states ?	and still many others -lrb- such as denver and portland -rrb- did not yet have any television service
before the freeze ended in 1952 , there were only 108 existing television stations in the united states ; a few major cities -lrb- such as boston -rrb- had only two television stations , many other cities -lrb- such as pittsburgh and st. louis -rrb- had only one , and still many others -lrb- such as denver and portland -rrb- did not yet have any television service .	how many stations did boston have in 1952 ?	and still many others -lrb- such as denver and portland -rrb- did not yet have any television service
in the fall of 1949 , abc found itself in the position of an outsider , with less coverage than two of its competing networks , cbs and nbc , even though it was on par with them in some major cities and had a headstart over its third rival at the time , the dumont television network .	who was abc 's third major rival in 1949 ?	even though it was on par with them in some major cities and had a headstart over its third rival at the time

at the end of 1949 , movie theater operator united paramount theatres -lrb- upt -rrb- was forced by the u.s. supreme court to become an independent entity , separating itself from paramount pictures .	who was upt forced to separate themselves from in 1949 ?	movie theater operator united paramount theatres -lrb- upt -rrb- was forced by the u
for its part , abc was on the verge of bankruptcy , with only five owned-and-operated stations and nine full-time affiliates .	how many affiliates did abc have in 1949 ?	with only five owned-and-operated stations and nine full-time affiliates
in 1951 , a rumor even mentioned that the network would be sold to cbs .	in 1951 , rumors claimed that abc might be sold to what network ?	a rumor even mentioned that the network would be sold to cbs
in 1951 , noble held a 58 % ownership stake in abc , giving him $ 5 million with which to prevent abc from going bankrupt ; as banks refused further credit , that amount was obtained through a loan from the prudential insurance company of america .	noble acquired a loan from what entity to keep abc solvent in 1951 ?	that amount was obtained through a loan from the prudential insurance company of america
leonard goldenson , the president of upt -lrb- which sought to diversify itself at the time -rrb- , approached noble in 1951 on a proposal for upt to purchase abc .	who was the president of upt in 1951 ?	the president of upt -lrb- which sought to diversify itself at the time -rrb-
noble received other offers , including one from cbs founder william s. paley ; however , a merger with cbs would have forced that network to sell its new york city and los angeles stations at the very least .	who was the founder of cbs ?	a merger with cbs would have forced that network to sell its new york city and los angeles stations at the very least
on june 6 , 1951 , the tentative agreement was approved by upt 's board of directors .	when was the agreement to acquire abc approved by upt 's board ?	the tentative agreement was approved by upt 's board of directors
in 1952 , when the release of the fcc 's sixth report and order announced the end of its freeze on new station license applications , among the issues the commission was slated to address was whether to approve the upt-abc merger .	when was the fcc 's sixth report and order released ?	when the release of the fcc 's sixth report and order announced the end of its freeze on new station license applications
on february 9 , 1953 , the fcc approved upt 's purchase of abc in exchange for $ 25 million in shares .	when did the fcc approve upt 's purchase of abc ?	the fcc approved upt 's purchase of abc in exchange for $ 25 million in shares
the merged company , renamed american broadcasting-paramount theatres , inc. and headquartered in the paramount building at 1501 broadway in manhattan , owned six am and several fm radio stations , five television stations and 644 cinemas in 300 u.s. cities .	when upt bough abc , what was the merged company called ?	and headquartered in the paramount building at 1501 broadway in manhattan
the merged company , renamed american broadcasting-paramount theatres , inc. and headquartered in the paramount building at 1501 broadway in manhattan , owned six am and several fm radio stations , five television stations and 644 cinemas in 300 u.s. cities .	where was american broadcasting-paramount theatres , inc headquartered after the merger ?	and headquartered in the paramount building at 1501 broadway in manhattan
the network 's flagship owned-and-operated station , wjz-tv in new york city -lrb- later re-called wabc-tv -rrb- , signed on the air on august 10 , 1948 , with its first broadcast running for two hours that evening .	when did wjz-tv in nyc begin broadcasting ?	wjz-tv in new york city -lrb- later re-called wabc-tv -rrb-
in october 1948 , as a result of an influx of television station license applications that it had issued as well as a study it undertook on the use of the vhf spectrum for broadcasting purposes , the fcc implemented a freeze on new station applications .	when did the fcc freeze incoming applications for new stations ?	as a result of an influx of television station license applications that it had issued as well as a study it undertook on the use of the vhf spectrum for broadcasting purposes
on may 7 , 1949 , billboard revealed that abc had proposed an investment of $ 6.25 million , of which it would spend $ 2.5 million to convert 20 acres -lrb- 80,937 m2 -rrb- of land in hollywood into what would become the prospect studios , and construct a transmitter on mount wilson , in anticipation of the launch of keca-tv , which was scheduled to begin operations on august 1 -lrb- but would not actually sign on until september 16 -rrb- .	where did abc construct it 's transmitter for its affiliate station in san francisco ?	which was scheduled to begin operations on august 1 -lrb- but would not actually sign on until september 16 -rrb-
on may 7 , 1949 , billboard revealed that abc had proposed an investment of $ 6.25 million , of which it would spend $ 2.5 million to convert 20 acres -lrb- 80,937 m2 -rrb- of land in hollywood into what would become the prospect studios , and construct a transmitter on mount wilson , in anticipation of the launch of keca-tv , which was scheduled to begin operations on august 1 -lrb- but would not actually sign on until september 16 -rrb- .	abc bought 20 acres of land in hollwood in 1949 that would become what studio ?	which was scheduled to begin operations on august 1 -lrb- but would not actually sign on until september 16 -rrb-
on september 30 , 1960 , abc premiered the flintstones , another example of counterprogramming ; although the animated series from william hanna and joseph barbera was filmed in color from the beginning , it was initially broadcast in black-and-white , as abc had not made the necessary technical upgrades to broadcast its programming in color at the time .	when did abc premier the flintstones ?	although the animated series from william hanna and joseph barbera was filmed in color from the beginning
the 1960s would be marked by the rise of family-oriented series in an attempt by abc to counterprogram its established competitors , but the decade was also marked by the network 's gradual transition to color .	what decade marked abc 's transition to color programming ?	the 1960s would be marked by the rise of family-oriented series in an attempt by abc to counterprogram its established competitors

the 1960s would be marked by the rise of family-oriented series in an attempt by abc to counterprogram its established competitors , but the decade was also marked by the network 's gradual transition to color .	when did abc begin making family-oriented series ?	the 1960s would be marked by the rise of family-oriented series in an attempt by abc to counterprogram its established competitors
in 1959 , walt disney productions , having improved its financial situation , had purchased abc 's shares in the disneyland theme park for $ 7.5 million and initiated discussions to renew abc 's television contract for walt disney presents , which was due to expire in 1961 .	when did walt disney productions purchase abc 's shares in the disneyland theme park ?	5 million and initiated discussions to renew abc 's television contract for walt disney presents
walt disney was approached by nbc to produce color broadcasts of his anthology series -lrb- which would be renamed walt disney 's wonderful world of color -rrb- .	what network approached walt disney about producing color broadcasts of his anthology series ?	walt disney was approached by nbc to produce color broadcasts of his anthology series -lrb- which would be renamed walt disney 's wonderful world of color -rrb-
as a result , abc and disney 's first television collaboration ended in 1961 -lrb- the network would resume its relationship with disney in 1985 , when the anthology series returned to the network for a three-season run as the disney sunday movie until it lost the rights to nbc again in 1988 ; the disney anthology series would return to abc in 1996 , following the company 's purchase of the future capital cities/abc , as the wonderful world of disney -rrb- .	when did abc and disney 's television relationship lapse ?	when the anthology series returned to the network for a three-season run as the disney sunday movie until it lost the rights to nbc again in 1988

in 2000 , abc launched a web-based promotional campaign focused around its circle logo , also called `` the dot '' , in which comic book character little dot prompted visitors to `` download the dot '' , a program which would cause the abc logo to fly around the screen and settle in the bottom-right corner .	in 2000 , abc started an internet based campaign focused on what ?	a program which would cause the abc logo to fly around the screen and settle in the bottom-right corner
the network hired the troika design group to design and produce its 2001 -- 02 identity , which continued using the black-and-yellow coloring of the logo and featured dots and stripes in various promotional and identification spots .	who was hired to produce abc 's 2001-02 identity ?	which continued using the black-and-yellow coloring of the logo and featured dots and stripes in various promotional and identification spots

in 1998 , the network began using a minimalist graphical identity , designed by pittard sullivan , featuring a small black-and-white `` abc circle '' logo on a yellow background -lrb- promotions during this time also featured a sequence of still photos of the stars of its programs during the timeslot card as well as the schedule sequence that began each night 's prime time lineup -rrb- .	who designed abc 's 1998 new graphic design ?	featuring a small black-and-white `` abc circle '' logo on a yellow background -lrb- promotions during this time also featured a sequence of still photos of the stars of its programs during the timeslot card as well as the schedule sequence that began each night 's prime time lineup -rrb-
in the fall of 2015 , abc is stopped with its 1998 -- 2002 four-note jingles for promotions and production company vanity cards following the closing credits of most of its programs over seventeen years , now it have a different and adventure-type music -lrb- with the drums of the network 's four-note signature in the ending -rrb- .	in what year did abc stop using it 's four-note jingle for promotion ?	abc is stopped with its 1998 -- 2002 four-note jingles for promotions and production company vanity cards following the closing credits of most of its programs over seventeen years
a new four-note theme tune was introduced alongside the package , based around the network 's `` we love tv '' image campaign introduced that year , creating an audio signature on par with the nbc chimes , cbs ' various three-note soundmarks -lrb- including the current version used since 2000 -rrb- and the fox fanfare .	what image campaign was the new four-note jingle for abc based around ?	cbs ' various three-note soundmarks -lrb- including the current version used since 2000 -rrb- and the fox fanfare
the old four-note theme tune is still used by abc on demand to the beginning of the abc show .	where is the abc four-note jingle still in use ?	the old four-note theme tune is still used by abc on demand to the beginning of the abc show
the abc logo first appeared as a on-screen bug in the 1993 -- 94 season , appearing initially only for 60 seconds at the beginning of an act or segment , before appearing throughout programs -lrb- except during commercial breaks -rrb- beginning in the 1995 -- 96 season ; the respective iterations of the translucent logo bug were also incorporated within program promotions until the 2011 -- 12 season .	in which season did the abc logo first appear as an on-screen bug ?	the respective iterations of the translucent logo bug were also incorporated within program promotions until the 2011 -- 12 season

in 1962 , graphic designer paul rand redesigned the abc logo into its best-known -lrb- and current -rrb- form , with the lowercase letters `` abc '' enclosed in a single black circle .	what graphic designer designed the abc logo in it 's most known form ?	graphic designer paul rand redesigned the abc logo into its best-known -lrb- and current -rrb- form
the letters are strongly reminiscent of the bauhaus typeface designed by herbert bayer in the 1920s , but also share similarities with several other fonts , such as itc avant garde and horatio , and most closely resembling chalet .	what typeface are the letters in the iconic abc logo reminiscent of ?	the letters are strongly reminiscent of the bauhaus typeface designed by herbert bayer in the 1920s

between may and september 2005 , rumors circulated that disney -- abc was considering a sale of abc radio , with clear channel communications and westwood one -lrb- which had earlier purchased nbc 's radio division , as well as the distribution rights to cbs 's , and the mutual broadcasting system during the 1990s -rrb- as potential buyers .	what entity was rumored to be sold by abc in between may and september 2005 ?	with clear channel communications and westwood one -lrb- which had earlier purchased nbc 's radio division
on october 19 , 2005 , abc announced the restructuring of the group into six divisions : entertainment communications , communications resources , kids communications , news communications , corporate communications , and international communications .	when did abc announce the restructure of abc radio ?	abc announced the restructuring of the group into six divisions : entertainment communications
on october 19 , 2005 , abc announced the restructuring of the group into six divisions : entertainment communications , communications resources , kids communications , news communications , corporate communications , and international communications .	how many divisions was abc radio restructured into in 2005 ?	abc announced the restructuring of the group into six divisions : entertainment communications
in 2004 , abc 's average viewership declined by ten ratings points , landing the network in fourth place , behind nbc , cbs and fox -lrb- by the following year , the combined season-ending average audience share of abc , nbc and cbs represented only 32 % of u.s. households -rrb- .	in what year did abc 's viewership end in 4th place behind the other major networks ?	the combined season-ending average audience share of abc
however , during the 2004 -- 05 season , the network experienced unexpected success with new series such as desperate housewives , lost and grey 's anatomy as well as reality series dancing with the stars , which helped abc rise to second place , jumping ahead of cbs , but behind a surging fox .	what new medical drama helped abc jump to second place in the ratings during the 2004-2005 season ?	the network experienced unexpected success with new series such as desperate housewives
on april 21 , 2004 , disney announced a restructuring of its disney media networks division with anne sweeney being named president of abc parent disney -- abc television group , and espn president george bodenheimer becoming co-ceo of the division with sweeney , as well as president of abc sports .	who was named president of disney-abc television group in 2004 ?	disney announced a restructuring of its disney media networks division with anne sweeney being named president of abc parent disney -- abc television group
on december 7 , 2005 , abc sports and espn signed an eight-year broadcast rights agreement with nascar , allowing abc and espn to broadcast 17 nextel cup races each season -lrb- comprising just over half of the 36 races held annually -rrb- effective with the 2006 season .	who did espn and abc sign an eight year deal with in 2005 ?	allowing abc and espn to broadcast 17 nextel cup races each season -lrb- comprising just over half of the 36 races held annually -rrb- effective with the 2006 season

on april 30 , 2000 , as a result of a carriage dispute with abc , time warner cable removed abc owned-and-operated stations from the cable provider 's systems in four markets -lrb- wabc-tv in new york city , kabc-tv in los angeles , ktrk in houston and wtvd in raleigh-durham -rrb- .	what cable company removed abc stations from it 's systems in certain markets in april 2000 ?	time warner cable removed abc owned-and-operated stations from the cable provider 's systems in four markets -lrb- wabc-tv in new york city
abc filed an emergency petition to the federal communications commission on may 1 to force twc to restore the affected stations ; the fcc ruled in favor of abc , ordering time warner cable to restore the stations , doing so on the afternoon of may 2 .	who did the fcc rule in favor of in the april 2000 dispute between time warner cable and abc ?	abc filed an emergency petition to the federal communications commission on may 1 to force twc to restore the affected stations
abc ended the 2000 -- 01 season as the most-watched network , ahead of nbc .	which major network was the most watched for the 2000-01 season ?	abc ended the 2000 -- 01 season as the most-watched network

hosted throughout its abc tenure by regis philbin , the program became a major ratings success throughout its initial summer run , which led abc to renew millionaire as a regular series , returning on january 18 , 2000 .	who originally hosted who wants to be a millionaire for abc ?	the program became a major ratings success throughout its initial summer run

on july 31 , 1995 , the walt disney company announced an agreement to merge with capital cities/abc for $ 19 billion .	when was the disney and abc merger first announced ?	the walt disney company announced an agreement to merge with capital cities/abc for $ 19 billion
disney shareholders approved the merger at a special conference in new york city on january 4 , 1996 , with the acquisition of capital cities/abc being completed on february 9 ; following the sale , disney renamed its new subsidiary abc inc. .	what did disney rename capital city/abc after first acquiring the company ?	disney shareholders approved the merger at a special conference in new york city on january 4
on april 4 , disney sold the four newspapers that abc had controlled under capital cities to knight ridder for $ 1.65 billion .	who did disney sell the four newspapers that abc controlled to ?	disney sold the four newspapers that abc had controlled under capital cities to knight ridder for $ 1
following the merger , thomas s. murphy left abc with robert iger taking his place as president and ceo .	who took thomas murphy 's place after the disney acquisition of abc ?	murphy left abc with robert iger taking his place as president and ceo
in 1998 , abc premiered the aaron sorkin-created sitcom sports night , centering on the travails of the staff of a sportscenter-style sports news program ; despite earning critical praise and multiple emmy awards , the series was cancelled in 2000 after two seasons .	what aaron sorkin created show did abc debut in 1998 ?	centering on the travails of the staff of a sportscenter-style sports news program
it was not until the 1965 -- 66 season that color became the dominant format for the three broadcast television networks .	for which tv season did color first become a dominant format ?	it was not until the 1965 -- 66 season that color became the dominant format for the three broadcast television networks
abc , meanwhile , remained in third place and still needed money to grow itself into a major competitor .	in the 1965-66 season , what place did abc find it 's self among the other networks in ratings ?	remained in third place and still needed money to grow itself into a major competitor
however , abc 's issues with its transition to color became secondary compared to the network 's financial problems ; in 1964 , the network found itself , as goldenson later wrote in the 1991 book `` beating the odds : the untold story behind the rise of abc '' , `` in the middle of a war -lsb- where -rsb- the battlefield was wall street '' .	what was goldenson 's 1991 book about abc titled ?	as goldenson later wrote in the 1991 book `` beating the odds : the untold story behind the rise of abc ''
on may 1 , 1953 , abc 's new york city flagship stations -- wjz , wjz-fm and wjz-tv -- changed their respective callsigns to wabc , wabc-fm and wabc-tv , and moved their operations to facilities at 7 west 66th street , one block away from central park .	when did abc 's new york flagship stations change their call signs ?	wjz-fm and wjz-tv -- changed their respective callsigns to wabc
on may 1 , 1953 , abc 's new york city flagship stations -- wjz , wjz-fm and wjz-tv -- changed their respective callsigns to wabc , wabc-fm and wabc-tv , and moved their operations to facilities at 7 west 66th street , one block away from central park .	where did the abc new york flagship stations move their facilities to in 1953 ?	wjz-fm and wjz-tv -- changed their respective callsigns to wabc
the wjz calls would later be reassigned to the then-abc affiliate in baltimore in 1959 , in an historical nod to the fact that wjz was originally established by the baltimore station 's owner at the time , westinghouse .	the wjz callsign would then be assigned to an abc affiliate in what city in 1959 ?	in an historical nod to the fact that wjz was originally established by the baltimore station 's owner at the time
in 1950 , noble appointed robert kintner to be abc 's president while he himself served as its ceo , a position he would hold until his death in 1958 .	who was appointed to be abc 's president by noble in 1950 ?	noble appointed robert kintner to be abc 's president while he himself served as its ceo
goldenson added to the confusion when , in october 1954 , he proposed a merger between upt and the dumont television network , which was also mired in financial trouble .	goldenson proposed a merger between upt and what network in october 1954 ?	he proposed a merger between upt and the dumont television network
as part of this merger , the network would have been renamed `` abc-dumont '' for five years , and dumont would have received $ 5 million in cash , room on the schedule for existing dumont programming , and guaranteed advertising time for dumont laboratories receivers .	under goldenson 's merger plan , what would the new entity be named ?	the network would have been renamed `` abc-dumont '' for five years
as part of this merger , the network would have been renamed `` abc-dumont '' for five years , and dumont would have received $ 5 million in cash , room on the schedule for existing dumont programming , and guaranteed advertising time for dumont laboratories receivers .	how much money was to go to dumont television network under goldenson 's merger plan ?	the network would have been renamed `` abc-dumont '' for five years
at the same time he made attempts to help grow abc , goldenson had been trying since mid-1953 to provide content for the network by contacting his old acquaintances in hollywood , with whom he had worked when upt was a subsidiary of paramount pictures .	of what hollywood film company was upt a subsidiary of when it merged with abc ?	goldenson had been trying since mid-1953 to provide content for the network by contacting his old acquaintances in hollywood
abc 's flagship productions at the time were the lone ranger , based on the radio program of the same title , and the adventures of ozzie and harriet , the latter of which -lrb- at 13 seasons , running from 1952 to 1965 -rrb- held the record for the longest-running prime time comedy in u.s. television history , until it was surpassed by the simpsons in 2002 .	what western was a flagship program for abc around 1954 ?	running from 1952 to 1965 -rrb- held the record for the longest-running prime time comedy in u
abc 's flagship productions at the time were the lone ranger , based on the radio program of the same title , and the adventures of ozzie and harriet , the latter of which -lrb- at 13 seasons , running from 1952 to 1965 -rrb- held the record for the longest-running prime time comedy in u.s. television history , until it was surpassed by the simpsons in 2002 .	what abc comedy had the record for the longest running comedy until being passed by the simpsons in 2002 ?	running from 1952 to 1965 -rrb- held the record for the longest-running prime time comedy in u
airing during the 1955 -- 56 season , it showcased television adaptations of the 1942 films kings row and casablanca ; cheyenne -lrb- adapted from the 1947 film wyoming kid -rrb- ; sugarfoot -lrb- a remake of the 1954 film the boy from oklahoma -rrb- ; and maverick .	what television show for abc was an adaptation of the 1947 film wyoming kid ?	it showcased television adaptations of the 1942 films kings row and casablanca

walt disney and his brother roy contacted goldenson at the end of 1953 for abc to agree to finance part of the disneyland project in exchange for producing a television program for the network .	what was walt disney 's brother 's name ?	walt disney and his brother roy contacted goldenson at the end of 1953 for abc to agree to finance part of the disneyland project in exchange for producing a television program for the network
walt wanted abc to invest $ 500,000 and accrued a guarantee of $ 4.5 million in additional loans , a third of the budget intended for the park .	how much did walt disney want abc to invest in disneyland ?	a third of the budget intended for the park
around 1954 , abc agreed to finance disneyland in exchange for the right to broadcast a new sunday night program , disneyland , which debuted on the network on october 27 , 1954 as the first of many anthology television programs that disney would broadcast over the course of the next 50 years .	in what year did abc agree to finance disneyland ?	1954 as the first of many anthology television programs that disney would broadcast over the course of the next 50 years

in july 1968 , abc radio launched a special programming project for its fm stations , which was spearheaded by allen shaw , a former program manager at wcfl in chicago who was approached by abc radio president harold l. neal to develop a format to compete with the new progressive rock and dj-helmed stations .	who lead the 1968 special programming for abc radio 's fm stations ?	a former program manager at wcfl in chicago who was approached by abc radio president harold l
in july 1968 , abc radio launched a special programming project for its fm stations , which was spearheaded by allen shaw , a former program manager at wcfl in chicago who was approached by abc radio president harold l. neal to develop a format to compete with the new progressive rock and dj-helmed stations .	who was the abc radio president in 1968 ?	a former program manager at wcfl in chicago who was approached by abc radio president harold l
the new concept called `` love radio '' , which featured a limited selection of music genres , was launched on abc 's seven owned-and-operated fm stations in late november 1968 ; the concept replaced nearly all of the programming provided by these stations ; however , several affiliates -lrb- such as kxyz -rrb- retained the majority of their content .	what was the name for the new radio concept designed by allen shaw ?	several affiliates -lrb- such as kxyz -rrb- retained the majority of their content
the new concept called `` love radio '' , which featured a limited selection of music genres , was launched on abc 's seven owned-and-operated fm stations in late november 1968 ; the concept replaced nearly all of the programming provided by these stations ; however , several affiliates -lrb- such as kxyz -rrb- retained the majority of their content .	how many abc music stations were owned-and-operated in 1968 ?	several affiliates -lrb- such as kxyz -rrb- retained the majority of their content
on the television side , in september 1969 , abc launched the movie of the week , a weekly showcase aimed at capitalizing on the growing success of made-for-tv movies since the early 1960s .	in what year did abc launch the movie of the week ?	a weekly showcase aimed at capitalizing on the growing success of made-for-tv movies since the early 1960s
the movie of the week broadcast feature-length dramatic films directed by such talented filmmakers as aaron spelling , david wolper and steven spielberg -lrb- the latter of whom gained early success through the showcase for his 1971 film duel -rrb- that were produced on an average budget of $ 400,000 -- $ 450,000 .	for which abc movie of the week film did steven spielberg first gain success ?	david wolper and steven spielberg -lrb- the latter of whom gained early success through the showcase for his 1971 film duel -rrb- that were produced on an average budget of $ 400

in the early 1970s , abc completed its transition to color ; the decade as a whole would mark a turning point for abc , as it began to pass cbs and nbc in the ratings to become the first place network .	in what decade did abc finish transitioning to color ?	as it began to pass cbs and nbc in the ratings to become the first place network

in 1970 , abc debuted monday night football as part of its monday prime time schedule ; the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006 , when sunday night football , which moved to nbc that year as part of a broadcast deal that in turn saw mnf move to espn , took over as the league 's marquee game .	what football program was debuted by abc in 1970 ?	the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006
in 1970 , abc debuted monday night football as part of its monday prime time schedule ; the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006 , when sunday night football , which moved to nbc that year as part of a broadcast deal that in turn saw mnf move to espn , took over as the league 's marquee game .	when did sunday night football premiere on nbc ?	the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006
in 1970 , abc debuted monday night football as part of its monday prime time schedule ; the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006 , when sunday night football , which moved to nbc that year as part of a broadcast deal that in turn saw mnf move to espn , took over as the league 's marquee game .	when sunday night football premiered , to which network did monday night football move ?	the program became a hit for the network and served as the national football league -lrb- nfl -rrb- 's premier game of the week until 2006
according to goldenson , monday night football helped earn abc regularly score an audience share of 15 % -- 16 % ; abc sports managed the budget for the monday night time slot to reallocate the weekly budget for abc 's prime time schedule to just six days , as opposed to seven on competing networks .	what kind of audience share did mnf allow abc to attain according to goldenson ?	abc sports managed the budget for the monday night time slot to reallocate the weekly budget for abc 's prime time schedule to just six days
in 1970 , the fcc voted to pass the financial interest and syndication rules , a set of regulations aimed at preventing the major networks from monopolizing the broadcast landscape by barring them from owning any of the prime time programming that they broadcast .	in what year did the fcc vote for the financial interest and syndication rules ?	a set of regulations aimed at preventing the major networks from monopolizing the broadcast landscape by barring them from owning any of the prime time programming that they broadcast
in 1972 , the new rules resulted in the company 's decision to split abc films into two separate companies : the existing worldvision enterprises , which would produce and distribute programming for u.s. syndication , and abc circle films as a production unit .	what year did the financial interest and syndication rules result in abc 's decision to split abc films into two companies ?	the new rules resulted in the company 's decision to split abc films into two separate companies : the existing worldvision enterprises
in 1972 , the new rules resulted in the company 's decision to split abc films into two separate companies : the existing worldvision enterprises , which would produce and distribute programming for u.s. syndication , and abc circle films as a production unit .	which new subdivision of abc films produced programming for u.s. syndication ?	the new rules resulted in the company 's decision to split abc films into two separate companies : the existing worldvision enterprises
in april 1970 , congress passed the public health cigarette smoking act which banned cigarette advertising from all television and radio networks , including abc , when it took effect on january 2 , 1971 .	what did the public health cigarette smoking act ban ?	congress passed the public health cigarette smoking act which banned cigarette advertising from all television and radio networks

citing limited profitability of its cinemas , abc great states , the central west division of abc theatres , was sold to henry plitt in 1974 .	who was abc great states sold to in 1974 ?	citing limited profitability of its cinemas

in the spring of 1975 , fred pierce , the newly appointed president of abc television , convinced fred silverman to become the first president and director of programming of the independent television production subsidiary abc entertainment , created from the network 's namesake programming division .	who was the president of abc television in 1976 ?	convinced fred silverman to become the first president and director of programming of the independent television production subsidiary abc entertainment

charlie 's angels and three 's company -lrb- which debuted in 1977 -rrb- were two prime examples of a trend among the major networks during the 1970s known as `` jiggle tv '' , featuring attractive , often buxom , women in main and guest roles .	what television trend are charlies angels and three 's company an example of ?	charlie 's angels and three 's company -lrb- which debuted in 1977 -rrb- were two prime examples of a trend among the major networks during the 1970s known as `` jiggle tv ''
for its part , the television network produced a few new hits during 1977 : january saw the premiere of roots , a miniseries based on an alex haley novel that was published the previous year ; in september , the love boat , a comedy-drama anthology series produced by aaron spelling which was based around the crew of a cruise ship and featured three stories centered partly on the ship 's various passengers ; although critically lambasted , the series turned out to be a ratings success and lasted nine seasons .	the roots miniseries was based on a novel by what author ?	a comedy-drama anthology series produced by aaron spelling which was based around the crew of a cruise ship and featured three stories centered partly on the ship 's various passengers
for its part , the television network produced a few new hits during 1977 : january saw the premiere of roots , a miniseries based on an alex haley novel that was published the previous year ; in september , the love boat , a comedy-drama anthology series produced by aaron spelling which was based around the crew of a cruise ship and featured three stories centered partly on the ship 's various passengers ; although critically lambasted , the series turned out to be a ratings success and lasted nine seasons .	who produced the comedy-drama the love boat ?	a comedy-drama anthology series produced by aaron spelling which was based around the crew of a cruise ship and featured three stories centered partly on the ship 's various passengers

the success of roots , happy days and the love boat allowed the network to take first place in the ratings for the first time in the 1976 -- 77 season .	during which season did abc first take the lead spot in television rating ?	happy days and the love boat allowed the network to take first place in the ratings for the first time in the 1976 -- 77 season
on september 13 , 1977 , the network debuted soap , a controversial soap opera parody which became known for being the first television series to feature an openly gay main character -lrb- played by a then-unknown billy crystal -rrb- ; it last ran on the network on april 20 , 1981 .	what was the first television series to feature an openly gay character ?	a controversial soap opera parody which became known for being the first television series to feature an openly gay main character -lrb- played by a then-unknown billy crystal -rrb-
